ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Misophonia
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient reports instant anger triggered by specific sounds (chewing, sniffing) despite normal hearing sensitivity and middle ear function.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing thresholds and rule out peripheral hearing loss.
To evaluate speech reception and recognition abilities.
To evaluate the acoustic reflex arc and neural integrity.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The audiological evaluation revealed normal hearing sensitivity bilaterally with excellent speech recognition. Immittance testing indicated normal middle ear function with Type A tympanograms and normal acoustic reflexes. These findings rule out peripheral pathology, supporting a diagnosis of misophonia based on the reported symptoms.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal thresholds (0-10 dB HL) from 250 to 8,000 Hz bilaterally.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT 7 dB (right) and 3 dB (left); WRS 100% at 50 dB HL bilaterally.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Type A tympanograms bilaterally (Right: 1.0 mL, 0.7 mmho, -10 daPa; Left: 1.1 mL, 0.9 mmho, 0 daPa).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Normal thresholds (80-90 dB HL) ipsilateral and contralateral; negative decay.

proposed_items: Sound therapy with BTE sound generators
counseling_actions: Explain that hearing is physically normal and the condition is Misophonia
Counsel on the brain's emotional reaction to specific sound patterns
Advise against constant hearing protection to avoid increasing sensitivity

escalation.rationale_short: To rule out any medical complications.
